channel.title: About me on Kate Stone | University of Potsdam
channel.description: Recent content in About me on Kate Stone | University of Potsdam

item.title: Bayesian divergence point analysis of visual world data
item.description: The visual world is a useful paradigm in psycholinguistics for tracking people’s eye fixations as they listen to sentences containing some kind of experimental manipulation. A common question is whether the experimental manipulation makes people look at a target object earlier in one condition than another. To answer this, we need to decide when in each condition people start looking at the target and compare these timepoints between conditions.

item.title: Publications
item.description: Papers Stone, K., Veríssimo, J., Schad, D., Oltrogge, E., Vasishth, S., & Lago, S. (in revision) The interaction of grammatically distinct agreement dependencies in predictive processing. [preprint] Stone, K., Nicenboim, B., Vasishth, S., & Rösler, F. (Stage 1 RR accepted) Understanding the effects of constraint and predictability in ERP. Neurobiology of Language. Stone, K., von der Malsburg, T., & Vasishth, S. (2020) The effect of decay and lexical uncertainty on processing long-distance dependencies in reading.
